alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 9:04PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: At 902 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms over eastern Fremont, southwestern EL Paso and northwestern Pueblo counties. This activity was moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Locally heavy rain is also occurring with this activity. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locally heavy rain will cause ponding of water on the roadways. This cluster of storms will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Fremont, southwestern El Paso and northwestern Pueblo Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern Colorado.
